title: Solomon's Administration and Wisdom
shortSummary: This chapter details King Solomon's wise and effective governance over Israel, highlighting his appointed officials, the vast provisions for his household, and the unparalleled wisdom God granted him. It emphasizes Solomon's peaceful and prosperous reign, marked by divine blessing and international renown.
timeline: c. 970 BC - Reign of King Solomon in Israel

keyCharacters.name: Solomon
keyCharacters.description: King of Israel who ruled with wisdom and established a well-organized government and prosperous kingdom.

keyCharacters.name: Azariah son of Zadok
keyCharacters.description: A chief priest and prince serving under Solomon, representing the priestly leadership.

keyCharacters.name: Benaiah son of Jehoiada
keyCharacters.description: Commander over the army, responsible for military leadership during Solomon's reign.

keyCharacters.name: Adoniram son of Abda
keyCharacters.description: Official in charge of tribute and forced labor, overseeing the kingdom’s resources.

definitions.definition: Government officials appointed to oversee various regions and administrative duties under the king.
Food supplies or provisions necessary to sustain the king and his household.
An official responsible for keeping records and royal correspondence.
Payments or taxes collected from the people or conquered territories for the king’s treasury.

outline.heading: Solomon’s Key Officials and Their Roles
outline.description: This section introduces Solomon’s principal officers and priests, highlighting the organized leadership structure that supported his reign and ensured effective governance.

outline.heading: Twelve Regional Officers Over Israel
outline.description: Solomon appointed twelve officers, each responsible for provisioning the king’s household for one month annually, demonstrating the kingdom’s wealth and administrative order.

outline.heading: Prosperity and Dominion of Solomon’s Kingdom
outline.description: The chapter describes the vast population, Solomon’s extensive dominion, abundant provisions, and military strength, illustrating the peace and prosperity under his reign.

outline.heading: God’s Gift of Wisdom to Solomon
outline.description: God grants Solomon exceptional wisdom, surpassing all others, which brings him fame and draws people from many nations to hear his wise sayings and proverbs.

application: Trust in God's provision and wisdom when undertaking leadership or stewardship responsibilities.
Recognize the importance of organized service and faithful administration in fulfilling God’s purposes.
Seek God’s wisdom earnestly, knowing it brings peace, prosperity, and influence for His glory.
Live in peace and contentment, trusting God’s sovereign hand over all circumstances.

keyVerses.text: And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and largeness of heart, even as the sand that is on the sea shore.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the divine source of Solomon’s unparalleled wisdom, which was foundational to his successful reign.

keyVerses.text: And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig tree, from Dan even to Beersheba, all the days of Solomon.
keyVerses.significance: This verse illustrates the peace and security that characterized Solomon’s reign, a blessing from God’s favor.

keyVerses.text: And there came of all people to hear the wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of the earth, which had heard of his wisdom.
keyVerses.significance: This verse shows the international recognition and influence of Solomon’s God-given wisdom.
